name: Residence Inn Sacramento Downtown at Capitol Park

reviews.text: I really enjoy the Residence Inn. This is the third one I've stayed in (also Kingston, ON and Aventura, FL). They are comfortable, homey, nice decorated. It's great having a living space, with a kitchen, and a king-size bed. The restaurant serves breakfast from 6:30 - 9:30, including hot foods (eggs, breakfast burritos, etc.) There are many, varied restaurants within walking distance (chinese, sushi, japanese steakhouse, indian, irish pub, etc. etc.). The capitol building and park are nearby.
reviews.title: A lovely location

reviews.text: Service was top notch, lead by a night manager that really cares and undertand the bussiness travelor. B fast was nice with variety and laid out to handle lots of guests. Rooms are residence is style and some have a kitchen equipped enough to host thanksgiving. Parking, pricey, close, only compliant you are required to use the top floors.
reviews.title: Room layout Provides that home feeling, great service try to avoid the parking

reviews.text: The residence is nestle in the downtown aera. You really can't tell it's even a hotel when you pull up. But once you there don't let the name fool you. It's definitely not some seeded place like motel 6 or red roof inn etc. This hotel is definitely a 4 1/2 star. The rooms are spacious, and logical, with full dining aera and kitchenette, complete with a complementary bag of popcorn. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. As of this review, the work out rooms has all new treadmills, and all of the weights are in great condition without that over use sweat metallic smell. The TV's are all flat screen too. And if you want to get out then the hotel also have bikes that you can rent.
reviews.title: Don't let the name fool yea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a chance to have an overnight date and chose to head to Sacramento. Our room was great! The studio with a king bed was perfect for the two of us. We walked to nearby restaurants and bars, what a great location! Impressed with the amenities, the breakfast looked like it would have been good (but we slept too long and it was over when we came down (10am)). Which was fine, due to all the close restaurant options. We will definitely stay here again! We were impressed with the vibrancy of this area of Sacramento!
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean and modern

reviews.text: So stayed here when we moved to Sacramento before we moved into our house. Good size rooms with the kitchen and living area with the separate bedroom. Clean and good service. Not the most exciting place in the world to stay, but does the job. Staff are very friendly.
reviews.title: Very functional

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip to Sacramento, one of my favorite cities. The hotel is a tall nondescript building at the eastern edge of downtown. But I was pleasantly surprised by how bright, warm and pleasant the lobby and my room was. All the staff I interacted with were exceptionally friendly and helpful. I loved my one bedroom suite. It was very well designed and comfortable. You could hear hallway noise in the living area, but once you were in the bedroom it was quiet, dark (with the curtains closed), with a comfortable quiet heating system and a great bed. Breakfast was good for a free breakfast and included lots of options and better quality foods than a best western/holiday inn. I would have had a fabulous stay if it wasn't for the parking situation. Parking is $17/night which is both too expensive for the hotel's location and waaaay too expensive for what you get. The hotel's parking spaces are on 3 of the top four floors of a 13 floor (7 main floors, 6 sub-floors) parking garage located next to the hotel. From the hotel, there's a sharp left turn and then to get into the lot an immediate turn right into a narrow opening against a tall concrete wall. It's a strange and difficult setup and I badly scraped the side of my rental car in the process. From the looks of that wall and the curb across from it, I'm not the only one to have trouble--there was lots of car paint, scratch marks, and crumbling concrete from other hotel guests. Then, guests are only allowed to park at the top so there's a long drive up which I fond frustrating as the garage is largely empty in the evenings. All of the spots were full except the top roofless level every time I tried to park (at 9pm, noon and 6pm). And because of the specific area leased by the hotel, none of the parking is both near the elevator and under a roof. Once you check into the hotel, you can use your key to access the garage from K St, between 15 and 16th. This is a typical garage entrance (and the only exit). It's a shame, because if they put a rubber bumper on the garage entrance and either dropped the price or leased lower floors, I would've loved this place. As it stands, I would recommend it if you don't have a car (although there are many hotels with a better walking location) or if you just need parking for the night and can park on the street. I'm pretty sure it's cheaper to park in that garage if you drive in the main entrance instead of dealing with the hotel so that's another option. For me, the stress of damaging a rental car was a distraction from my trip and makes it hard to rate this hotel highly.
reviews.title: Great hotel with crappy parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband is a Marriott's reward member and we had to use our free certificate before it expired. We decided to book downtown just for the evening. This is a great location...we did not pay for parking because it is free after 6pm on the street and we did a late check in and early check out.
reviews.title: Local gal just getting out for the night to Staycation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 1 bedroom suite with king bed was great. It had a full kitchen (with two stove burners) and a large stainless steel fridge. We were only there for the night, but this place would be great for an extended stay. The lobby staff was friendly and you are within walking distance to a lot of great restaurants.
reviews.title: Loved the one bedroom suite...

reviews.text: The room has a small dining table and a desk...is was set up very nicely and was very clean.
reviews.title: Will recommend this place

reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was fairly decent, although they could have improved on the traffic flow with food item condiments placed in various locations.
reviews.title: Best hotel we've ever stayed at!

reviews.text: This is more a review of the customer service more than anything. I made a reservation and then later cancelled it the next day. The guy on the phone said that the card was not charged. The next day the card was charged!
reviews.title: Rating Customer Service

reviews.text: I tried to get this reversed but the person on the line insisted I missed the deadline. It's still in negotiation but you know I'm never going to a Marriott Hotel again. Be advised to read their fine print on reservations.
reviews.title: Great place to stay downtown

reviews.text: The rooms are a little small, but they are comfortable and very clean and are equipped with a fridge. The front office staff are very courteous and helpful. It is located on a more quiet street than most of the downtown hotels, but it is still walking distance to lots of restaurants.
reviews.title: Good business accommodations

reviews.text: The restaurant has great food plus a full bar and the bartenders were friendly and generous. Room reminded me of an extended stay joint...not as nice as other Res Inns I've seen, but it was very clean and very comfy. Probably one of the best DT Sacramento options available.
reviews.title: Great place for a run

reviews.text: A great place near capital park to stay. Runners dream come true as the run along capital park is lovely and easy and ends at the river. Turn around can be straight back or up a letter street. The hotel is north of the capital and a walk to more touristy areas. I found the hotel to be quiet and comfortable, far enough away to be quiet and close enough to enjoy Sacramento.
reviews.title: I am jaded for life... no other hotel will ever match this experience.

reviews.text: Stayed here for a few nights, which included a Friday and Saturday night. We were up on one of the higher floors, but could still hear the music (mainly the bass) from the restaurant/bar located in the hotel on the ground floor (our room was facing the main street that goes by the hotel entrance). When I went down to the front desk to ask as to how long the music would be going in the bar (and it was very loud at the ground level), I was told that was normal for a weekend night, but that they would ask the bar to lower the bass level of the music. Unfortunately, that didn't happen on either night, and along with the general noise from the people on the street (which had nothing to do with the hotel -- there were just a lot of people walking around, hollering and even playing a saxophone), it was way too noisy for us. I understand people in the bar wanting to have a good time (and I'm OK with that), but the folks staying in the hotel, especially if you're up on a higher floor, shouldn't have to hear the music coming from the bar (as I previously said, the street noise is a different issue, and the hotel can't do anything about that). Since the bass "thumping" I heard in my room continued after talking to the front desk (on both nights), I don't think they even bothered asking the bar to lower it.
reviews.title: Way too noisy on the weekend

reviews.text: So, if you happen to be a party-type person that doesn't mind the street noise and the very loud music coming from the bar (and we know that people a couple of floors above us also heard the music from the bar), you may want to find another place to stay.
reviews.title: Becoming like home

reviews.text: I also agree with the other reviewers regarding the parking situation -- very tight just trying to get in to the garage, and you have to go to the top three floors, but since the hotel doesn't own the garage, there really isn't a way around this, other than to park on the street (and I don't think I would recommend doing that, based on all the commotion on the streets at night around this hotel).
reviews.title: Great location with lots of extras

reviews.text: As for the room itself, I personally thought they were a bit cramped (small) compared to other Residence Inn's I've stayed at, but they did seem fairly clean.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay, but with LOW speed internet and extra charge for parking

reviews.text: Pros: For frequent guests, the staff gets to know you pretty quickly and everyone's quite nice. Location is good, walking distance to restaurants, parks, and shopping. Rooms are typical of the newer style Residence Inn, and very well maintained.
reviews.title: Excellent value for price

aka: Residence Inn Sacramento Downtown At Capitol Park Hotel Sacramento
description: Stay at Sacramento's only Residence Inn that offers a full service experience in the heart of Downtown. Conveniently located one block from the State Capitol and the Convention Center, our downtown location offers world class restaurants, theaters, museums and city wide events all within walking distance. This beautiful 15-story hotel offers 235 spacious suites that include fully-equipped kitchens, living rooms with plenty of space for relaxing & entertaining. Our 3 Fires Lounge located just off the lobby offers a lunch and dinner menu as well as in room dining. We make your stay more enjoyable with complimentary grocery shopping & on-site laundry facilities. Don't forget to join us for our complimentary hot breakfast buffet each morning. Relax by our pool or soak in the spa to melt tensions away. Whether traveling for business or pleasure, our friendly staff takes pride in exceeding your every expectation!
